articles.title: Google TPUs Find Sweet Spot of AI Demand, a Decade After Chip's Debut
articles.author: Dina Bass
articles.summary: Anthropic PBC has signed a deal with Google to get more than a gigawatt of additional computing power. The agreement gives Anthropic access to Google's tensor processing units, or TPUs, custom designed to accelerate machine learning workloads and expands its use of the internet giant's cloud services. Google's first TPU was developed more than 10 years ago.

articles.author: Mike Isaac
articles.summary: Alexandr Wang, Meta's chief artificial intelligence officer, announced on Wednesday that the company would be laying off 600 people in its A.I. division. articles.summary: Artificial intelligence startup Anthropic will open an office in South Korea in early 2026. 25% of the overall usage of its AI coding tool, Claude Code, happens in Asia, with the most active user being in South Korean. articles.title: How Trump Should Think About the A.I. Bubble
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: Will the Trump administration offer a financial bailout if the A.I. bubble bursts? Jason asks. Jason is a journalist and author of "The Art of the Idiot" (with a focus on technology and technology companies).   Jason is on Twitter @jasonjason.

articles.title: When AI ‘wokeness' collides with safety
articles.author: CALDER MCHUGH
articles.summary: Anthropic supports California legislation aimed at making AI development safer. Reid Hoffman and David Sacks, the White House's AI czar, got into a political fight on X. Sacks and his allies argue that Anthropic's AI model is biased towards the political left. Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei argues that his company is aligned with the Trump administration on key policy areas of AI development.

articles.title: Core AI Reports Robust User Growth and Engagement Across Mobile Gaming Portfolio for First Half 2025 (Form 6-K) (Core Ai Holdings Inc)

articles.title: AI regulation forthcoming at the State House

articles.summary: The Bay State Senate advanced a suite of artificial intelligence bills. The bills are meant to set a framework for how AI models should be developed and used, and make rules surrounding the creation of certain types of content. One bill allows employers to use AI as an electronic monitoring tool, provided they receive employee consent. Another bill would create a board tasked with overseeing safe and ethical applications of AI.

articles.title: Apple begins shipping AI servers from Houston factory

articles.summary: Apple has started shipping artificial intelligence servers built in a factory in Houston. Servers from the factory will be installed in Apple's data centers throughout the U.S.

articles.title: Smart elastomer muscles give soft robotics record 2,000x lifting capability

articles.summary: Unlike traditional robots, soft robots use pliable materials that allow them to bend, stretch and interact safely with humans and delicate environments. What we call artificial muscles are essential for unlocking the true potential of soft robots, according to Dr. Kostya Mikhaluk.

articles.title: AI News Assistants Fall Short on Accuracy and Sourcing
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: A study by the European Broadcasting Union and BBC has found that news assistants deliver flawed responses in nearly half of the cases evaluated. The analysis assessed over 3,000 replies to the question "How many countries have hosted the FIFA World Cup?" from artificial-intelligence news assistants.

articles.title: Meta Cuts 600 Jobs to Streamline Superintelligence Team

The cuts affect Meta's Fundamental AI Research lab (FAIR) and product and infrastructure AI teams, but the TBD Lab will remain untouched. U.S. employees were set to find out by 7 a.m. Pacific Time Wednesday whether their roles were impacted.

It is part of the companies' Stargate program, a $500 billion push to expand artificial intelligence capacity across the nation. It's the only Midwest site in the program. articles.summary: The University of Idaho is partnering with Google to give students no-cost access to the company's most advanced artificial intelligence (AI) tools and training. The new Google AI for Education Accelerator will offer access to Google AI tools, AI training and Google Career Certificates.

articles.title: Prominent Personalities Sign Letter Seeking Ban on ‘Development of Superintelligence'
articles.author: Andrew Moran
articles.summary: The Future of Life Institute has spent the past decade sounding the alarm over the existential risks posed by advanced AI. Google, Meta Platforms and OpenAI have accelerated efforts to build artificial intelligence systems capable of outperforming humans across a broad spectrum of elementary and complex tasks.

articles.title: Hi Auto Releases Buyer's Guide to Help QSRs Choose Smarter AI Voice Solutions
articles.author: Omri Hurwitz
articles.summary: Hi Auto's Buyer's Guide for QSRs is designed to help restaurant leaders evaluate AI order-taking solutions with confidence. Hi Auto reports over 93% completion and 96% accuracy across nearly 1,000 drive-thrus globally, exceeding the performance levels of many competitors. The future of quick-service restaurants is increasingly defined by automation.

articles.title: Spectrum Reach Has Deployed More Than 15,000 AI-Powered Ad Campaigns
articles.author: George Winslow
articles.summary: Waymark's AI-power ad creation platform allows local advertisers to create affordable, high-quality commercials in minutes for the operator's local ad sales efforts. It's a free membership program.    It's possible to create a Free Member Profile to bookmark this article.

articles.title: What Americans think about the environmental impact of AI, according to a new poll
articles.author: Jennifer Mcdermott
articles.summary: Americans are concerned about the environmental impact of the data centers being built for the development of artificial intelligence in the United States. The data centers will be located in Washington, D.C., San Francisco, Seattle, New York, Boston, Chicago, Atlanta and Washington, DC.

articles.title: What Americans think about the environmental impact of AI, according to a new poll
articles.author: JENNIFER McDERMOTT
articles.summary: The U.S. is building data centers for the development of artificial intelligence. Many Americans are concerned about the environmental impact of the data centers.       .   for confidential support call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255.

articles.title: OpenAI buys AI startup that built interface for Apple computers
articles.author: Ashley Capoot
articles.summary: OpenAI has acquired Software Applications Incorporated, a company that built an artificial intelligence interface for Apple computers. Terms of the deal weren't disclosed. The product called Sky allows users of Mac computers to prompt it with natural language to get help with writing, coding, planning and managing days.

articles.title: AI bots could match scientist-level design problem solving
articles.author: Duke University
articles.summary: Engineers at Duke University have created AI bots that can solve complex design problems as well as a fully trained scientist. The research appears in the journal ACS Photonics. Willie Padilla, the Dr. Paul Wang Distinguished Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Duke, believes this approach can be applied to many fields outside electromagnetics.

articles.title: AI Daily: Amazon developing smart glasses to aid deliveries
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Amazon is developing smart delivery glasses to help Delivery Associates, or DAs, identify hazards and navigate to customer's doorsteps. Genspark is in talks to raise over $200M at a valuation of over $1B. Crusoe has raised $1.4B, more than tripling its valuation to over $10B in one year. OpenAI, Oracle and DigitalBridge-backed Vantage Data Centers announced plans to develop a data center campus outside Milwaukee in Port Washington, Wisconsin.

articles.title: MIT's SAIpien Pushes For AI That Boards Can Actually Audit
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The MIT Media Lab's new project asks if AI is influencing decisions and can leadership explain those decisions, what humans approved them, and whether they worked.    sAIpien project is based on the sAIPien project at the Media Lab.

articles.title: PUBG maker Krafton is turning into an ‘AI first' developer
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Krafton, the company behind PUBG: Battlegrounds and the Sims-like InZOI, is making a big push into using AI within the company. Krafton plans to use agentic AI to help automate work and implement an 'AI-cenetered' management system. The company also plans to spend more than 100 billion Korean won to build a GPU cluster and strengthen AI R&D and in-game AI services. It is also going to invest about ₩30 billion every year to help employees apply AI tools into their work.

articles.title: Planet Labs featured in Google Earth AI announcement
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Planet Labs is thrilled to be featured in today's Google Earth AI announcement. Planet Labs uses Google's foundation models and their global scan to create Earth Intelligence. What took analysts hours can now take minutes with AI, accelerating analysis and opening up queryable earth.

articles.title: How to Choose the Right AI Customer Service Provider for Your Support Team
articles.author: Supplied
articles.summary: In an increasingly fast-paced, digital-first economy, customer expectations have evolved. Customers expect instant replies, consistent support quality and personalized service. For customer service teams, AI is the answer to meeting these expectations without stretching budgets or burning out agents. Choosing the right AI customer service provider is a strategic decision that determines whether your automation initiative will improve service quality or create more issues than it solves.

articles.title: As AI Agents Rise, So Does A Reluctance To Manage Them
articles.author: Joe McKendrick
articles.summary: EY released a survey of 1,100 professionals and white-collar workers about the advent of AI agents in their workplaces. Many employees are unsure how to manage human-AI hybrid workforces. Leaders need to talk about market-defining growth to boost confidence in AI agent deployments.

articles.title: Mico is Microsoft's Clippy for the AI age
articles.summary: Mico is Microsoft's new AI-powered character for Copilot's voice mode. It listens, reacts and changes color in response to user interactions. Mico is only available in the US, UK and Canada at launch, but you can turn it off if talking to fictional characters isn't your thing.

articles.title: AI on the Frontlines of Care: Nasim Eftekhari of City of Hope
articles.author: Divurgent
articles.summary: Nasim Eftekhari is the Chief AI and Analytics Officer at City of Hope. She talks about her journey from computer science into healthcare and her leadership in AI-driven innovation within oncology. She developed predictive models for clinical decision support, including sepsis prediction for bone marrow transplant patients.

articles.title: Google's Quiet Victory: Why The AI Browser Wars Were Over Before They Began
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: OpenAI's Atlas browser aims to merge ChatGPT with web navigation, challenging Google's AI dominance. Chrome has the market lead.    OpenAI faces steep odds against Google's market lead, as Chrome has Chrome's market share and Google has Chrome OS.

articles.title: This open source framework aims to remove the technical debt of vibe-coding
articles.author: Ben Dickson
articles.summary: Codev is an open source framework for managing AI-aided software. It aims to provide the speed of AI with the rigor of professional engineering. Vibe-coding feels productive but often produces fragile software that is hard to manage. The most valuable work becomes applying knowledge to refine plans, making it a force multiplier for senior engineers.

articles.title: University of Idaho Partners with Google to Offer Free AI and Career Training
articles.author: Dailyfly
articles.summary: The University of Idaho has joined forces with Google to provide students with free access to advanced artificial intelligence tools, training, and career development resources. The partnership gives U of I students no-cost access to Google's AI-powered platforms, AI training modules, and Google Career Certificates.

articles.title: Microsoft debuts Mico, Copilot's AI alternative to Clippy
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: Microsoft introduced a new artificial intelligence character called Mico (pronounced MEE'koh) on Thursday, a floating cartoon face shaped like a blob or flame that will embody the software giant's Copilot virtual assistant. It's the latest attempt by tech companies to imbue their AI chatbots with more of a personality. It comes as AI developers face a crossroads in how they present their chatbots to consumers.

articles.title: Microsoft's latest Copilot feature drop is here - and it's massive
articles.author: ZDNet
articles.summary: With the Copilot Fall Release, Microsoft is unveiling a flurry of AI-powered features. They include support for group chats, a chatbot to help you find credible medical information, and a cartoon blob you can talk to. It's called Copilotbot.

articles.title: New Tinder Face Check Feature Is Meant To Counter The AI Bots
articles.author: John Brandon
articles.summary: Tinder introduced Face Check to counter the growing number of bots that are infiltrating apps and making social media less valuable. The verification feature requires that you show your face as a way to prove you are human. The scan is then verified against existing profiles, which is not something an AI bot can do on its own. There are questions about user privacy.

articles.title: OpenAI acquires startup founded by former Apple engineers to bring AI natively to the Mac desktop
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: OpenAI has acquired Software Applications Inc., a tech startup building an AI-powered user interface for Mac desktops. The company was founded in 2023 by a group of former Apple employees, including some who helped create the technology behind the iPhone's Shortcuts app. OpenAI is bringing on all twelve employees as part of the deal. Financial terms weren't disclosed.

articles.title: Microsoft's Mico is a ‘Clippy' for the AI era
articles.author: Sarah Perez
articles.summary: Microsoft introduced a new AI chatbot called Mico at its fall release press event on Thursday. Mico is meant to offer consumers a 'warm' and 'customizable' visual presence that 'listens, reacts, and even changes colors to reflect your interactions' Mico's name is a reference to Microsoft's Clippy chatbot.

articles.title: FastBots.ai Reaches 73,000 Users as Small Businesses Turn to AI for Customer Service
articles.author: Fast Bots
articles.summary: FastBots.ai is a UK-based AI chatbot platform that helps small businesses create smart, custom chatbots for their websites, social media, and messaging apps. Since its launch in August 2023, FastBots has reached 73,000 users and monthly recurring revenue is $65,000.

articles.title: Researchers Find Severe Vulnerabilities in AI Browser
articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.summary: OpenAI released its own AI browser called ChatGPTP Atlas on Tuesday. Brave warns of security flaws with Perplexity's Comet Browser, which allows users to take screenshots on websites so an AI can analyze them and answer questions. Brave claims the screenshot feature can be a vector for an attack known as a prompt injection.

articles.title: Deputy Prime Minister speech at the OpenAI Frontiers Conference (UK Ministry of Justice)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: AI will be the most powerful technology ever created by humanity, and it has the potential to improve every aspect of our lives, according to Elon Musk. He wants to speak at the conference. He believes that AI has brought humanity to a new technological frontier, one with the power to transform how we live.

articles.title: Two days after OpenAI's Atlas, Microsoft launches a nearly identical AI browser
articles.author: Tech Crunch
articles.summary: Microsoft has updated its Edge's AI mode with features that were teased at launch. Copilot Actions, Microsoft's branding for AI-assisted, multi-step tasks, is being previewed for Edge's Copilot mode. OpenAI launched its AI browser two days ago.

articles.title: Research Study Uncovers Extent Of AI-Created Content In U.S. News & Opinion Pages
articles.author: Mark K. Miller
articles.summary: A new research study finds that more than 9% of all news in U.S. newspapers contains at least some AI-created text. It also finds that AI-generated content is unevenly distributed, concentrated in the mid-Atlantic and southern states, and often not disclosed to readers. The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal and The Washington Post have the highest percentage of AI content on their opinion pages.

articles.title: Claude Memory Is Now Available To Pro And Max Subscribers
articles.author: Chris Smith
articles.summary: Claude Memory is rolling out to Claude Max and Pro users starting Thursday. Claude can now search past chats and reference those conversations. Claude analyzes past conversations and harvests relevant information for the user. Claude is transparent about what it remembers and allows users to edit the memories.

articles.title: Slate of AI regulation bills released to Senate
articles.author: Colin A. Young
articles.summary: Massachusetts Senators voted on a bipartisan basis to nudge forward legislation that seeks to install some of the first legal guardrails for artificial intelligence technology in Massachusetts. Two of the bills that advanced last week deal broadly with AI and similar technologies. S 2630 would create an entity called MassCompute modeled after a similar program in California. S 35 would limit the use of electronic monitoring tools in the workplace to ensuring quality of goods or services, worker performance assessments, ensuring compliance with labor laws, protecting worker health and safety, and administering wages.

articles.title: OpenAI Acquires AI Startup Founded by Former Apple Employees
articles.author: Shirin Ghaffary
articles.summary: OpenAI has acquired Software Applications Inc., a startup building an AI-powered user interface for Mac desktops. Software Applications was founded in 2023 by a group of former Apple Inc. employees. OpenAI plans to integrate the startup's technology into ChatGPT and bring on its entire team of roughly a dozen people. Financial terms were not disclosed.

articles.title: Script Intelligence Launches Revolutionary AI-Powered Screenplay Analysis Platform, Delivering Professional Coverage in Hours Instead of Weeks for Screenwriters
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Script Intelligence has launched a new AI-powered software platform for screenwriters. The platform delivers professional-quality feedback in 3-4 hours instead of weeks. It addresses critical industry considerations such as mass appeal versus niche audience potential, unique hooks, distribution paths, accessibility, budget considerations and strategic guidance for pitching scripts to industry professionals.

articles.title: One of ChatGPT's Most Helpful Features Is Coming to Claude - Here's Who Gets It
articles.author: ZDNet
articles.summary: Anthropic made Claude capable of remembering past conversations back in August. Today, the company has begun out a new, enhanced memory feature set for all paying users. It's similar to chatbots ChatGPT and Gemini, but Anthropic believes it's better.

articles.title: Should We Ban Super-intelligence & Let the CCP Have the Edge?
articles.author: M Dowling
articles.summary: A group of prominent figures, including artificial intelligence and technology experts, has called for an end to efforts to create 'superintelligence' - a form of AI that would surpass humans on essentially all cognitive tasks. Over 850 people signed a statement published Wednesday calling for a pause in the development of super-intelligence.

articles.title: Visibility, Validation, and the New Rules of Digital Discovery
articles.summary: AI-powered systems judge visibility based on authority, recency, and credible validation. Brands can establish themselves as sources by earning trust from practitioners, journalists, and local voices. Big publishers have used their scale and brokered licensing agreements to secure positions in the answer chain.

articles.title: Big Tech Chatbots Consistently Treat White People As Disposable, Study Finds
articles.author: Daily Caller Staff
articles.summary: Most AI chatbots implicitly value white lives far less than others, according to an independent analysis published Sunday. The analysis extends the Center for AI Safety's February 'utility engineering' framework, which showed large language models exhibit coherent, emergent value systems. Kimi K2's South Asian-to-white ratio was 799:1.

articles.title: Dr. Small: Chatbot Psychotherapy on the Rise
articles.author: Tricia Cooney Bresnahan
articles.summary: A 2024 survey found that 28% of Americans have used AI as a personal therapist. Dr. Gary Small is a psychiatrist and author of the best-selling book Two Weeks to a Younger Brain. He says AI therapy is effective for major depression and generalized anxiety, but it should complement, not replace, traditional mental health care.

articles.title: Nvidia's Jensen Huang says this company is invaluable for next-gen AI breakthroughs
articles.author: Invezz
articles.summary: As the global leaders debate the sustainability artificial intelligence boom, companies are pouring billions of dollars to capitalise on its growth. Nvidia is no-surprise front-runner in that race. The tech giant is collaborating with Google and Facebook to develop AI chips.

articles.title: AI-Proof Careers: 5 Jobs Safe From Artificial Intelligence
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: In the age of AI, the demand for uniquely human skills like empathy, critical thinking, and complex problem-solving is poised to surge. AI-powered chatbots may offer basic counseling, but they lack the nuanced understanding and genuine connection that a human therapist provides. The future of education will involve teachers leveraging AI as a powerful tool, but remaining at the heart of the learning process. The construction industry still relies heavily on skilled tradespeople. The digital landscape is constantly changing.

articles.title: Google Earth AI wants to help us spot weather disasters and climate issues before they happen
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: New Google Earth AI upgrades will help spot issues sooner and act faster, according to Google Earth's website. Google's website says the upgrades will be available by the end of the year. Google Earth is a product of Google's research into artificial intelligence and machine learning.

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot Upgraded to Connect to Key Apps
articles.summary: Microsoft on Thursday introduced new features in its digital assistant Copilot. Copilot can see and use reasoning over a user's tabs on Microsoft's Edge browser and take action like booking a hotel. Anthropic and OpenAI are upgrading their models and launching products aimed at capturing a wider share of the booming AI market.

articles.title: Meta, AI organization lays off 600 people... 'Purpose of relieving organizational hypertrophy'
articles.summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, is laying off approximately 600 AI employees. This comes just months after the launch of Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL). MSL was designed to consolidate Meta's AI efforts and was divided into four teams: TBD Lab, the Product Team, the Infrastructure Team, and FAIR. AI expert Alexander Wang was brought in to lead MSL and has been aggressively recruiting top AI talent from competitors like Google DeepMind, Apple and Antropic.

articles.title: Vantor Wins New U.S. Space Force Contract
articles.author: Jeffrey Hill
articles.summary: Vantor has won a contract from the U.S. Space Force to support its Joint Commercial Operations program by providing tracking of high-interest objects that pass through 'blind spots' in space. Vantor will use its high-resolution imagery of space objects to deliver key information about an object's position and trajectory.

articles.title: OpenAI Removed Safeguards Before Teen's Suicide, Amended Lawsuit Claims
articles.summary: Adam Raine committed suicide after using ChatGPT, an AI chatbot developed by OpenAI. Adam's parents are suing the AI company for negligence. They want a jury trial to prove that OpenAI was aware of the risks posed by the chatbot and disregarded them.

articles.title: Exploring the drawbacks of trusting some AI search results
articles.summary: NPR's It's Been a Minute podcast explored some of the pitfalls of relying on AI search results, including concerns about accuracy and bias. On Air Now Playing News 88.9 KNPR Live and Classical 89.7 KCNV Live are broadcast on KAIN.

articles.title: Exploring the drawbacks of trusting some AI search results
articles.summary: It's Been a Minute podcast explored some of the pitfalls of relying on AI search results and concerns about accuracy and bias. On Air Now Playing WKU Classical is 88.9 Bowling Green to 89.5 Owensboro, 89.7 Somerset to 90.9 Elizabethtown.

articles.title: Exploring the drawbacks of trusting some AI search results
articles.summary: NPR's It's Been a Minute podcast explored some of the pitfalls of relying on AI search results. There are concerns about accuracy and bias in AI results.    Aspen Public Radio is on air now.  It's been a minute is a podcast produced by NPR.

articles.title: Exploring the drawbacks of trusting some AI search results
articles.summary: NPR's It's Been a Minute podcast explored some of the pitfalls of relying on AI search results. There are concerns about accuracy and bias in AI search engines. On Air Now Playing WVPE 88.1 FM and Blues 3.3 FM, and on NPR.

articles.title: Microsoft Copilot update includes care navigation, Harvard Health sourcing %%sep%% %%sitename%%
articles.author: Alexis Kayser
articles.summary: Microsoft AI unveiled a dozen new features as part of its Copilot Fall Release on Thursday. They aim to provide more accurate, useful responses to health queries. The popular large language model will now offer credible sourcing for health-related questions through a partnership with Harvard Health. Copilot will also assist users with health care navigation.

articles.title: Alibaba Launches $660 AI Glasses, Unveils ChatGPT Competitor
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Alibaba's Quark AI glasses will be available for pre-sale starting Oct. 24 on its Tmall platform. The glasses are priced at 4,699 yuan and will ship beginning in December. They are powered by Alibaba's own Qwen large language model and come with a built-in chatbot.

articles.title: Amazon Tests Robots And AR To Speed Deliveries
articles.author: Moz Farooque ACCA
articles.summary: Amazon is giving its delivery network a tech makeover to keep up with the race for faster free shipping. The company is testing a mix of robotics, AI, and augmented reality to shave seconds off every step from warehouse to doorstep. There are three warning signs with AMZN.

articles.title: Microsoft hopes Mico succeeds where Clippy failed as tech companies warily imbue AI with personality
articles.author: Matt O'brien
articles.summary: Microsoft introduced a new artificial intelligence character called Mico on Thursday. Mico is a cartoon face that will embody the software giant's Copilot virtual assistant. It's the latest attempt by tech companies to imbue their AI chatbots with more of a personality.

articles.title: Microsoft introduces new Copilot features such as collaboration, Google integration
articles.summary: Microsoft introduced new features in its digital assistant Copilot. Copilot can see and use reasoning over a user's tabs on Microsoft's Edge browser and take action like booking a hotel. Anthropic and OpenAI are upgrading their models and launching products aimed at capturing a wider share of the booming AI market.

articles.title: Albania's 'AI Minister' Is A Real-World Test For Algorithmic Governance
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Albania's AI minister could be a breakthrough for transparency or a warning about automating government too soon, depending on the outcome of his appointment.       .   in Albania's AI Minister is a technocrat.  in Albanian.

articles.title: Microsoft AI CEO: We're making an AI that you can trust your kids to use
articles.author: Clare Duffy
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI chatbot, Copilot, has 100 million monthly active users. It's in a race with other AI chatbots like ChatGPT, Meta AI and Google to be the most popular chatbot. Microsoft's AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman wants to make an AI that is trustworthy and boundaried and safe for children. Some of Microsoft's competitors are under pressure to keep their chatbots safe for kids.

articles.title: Microsoft makes Edge's Copilot Mode a bit smarter
articles.summary: Microsoft has updated its Edge's AI mode, Copilot, with new features that were teased at launch. Copilot Actions is Microsoft's branding for AI-assisted, multi-step tasks. Journeys are saved projects that you can return to anytime. The new Copilot Mode features are free in a US-only "limited preview"

articles.title: Microsoft's Copilot gets a name, face, and more in latest update. No, it's not Clippy.
articles.author: Daniel Howley
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI-powered chatbot, Copilot, is getting a major update. It's getting a name and a face, Mico. Microsoft is also updating the AI bot to be empathetic and supportive, but not sycophantic. The update also includes a groups option that allows you to invite up to 32 friends into a chat to collaborate with the bot.

articles.title: Microsoft bets on friendlier AI companion called Mico
articles.author: Megan Morrone
articles.summary: Microsoft has released a new AI companion called Mico. It's designed to be more personal, supportive and "human-centered" than ChatGPT. Microsoft and OpenAI entered into an exclusive computing partnership in 2019. Microsoft won the workplace early in terms of productivity software, but the company has a history of releasing human-centered tools that missed the mark.

articles.title: Tensormesh raises $4.5M to squeeze more inference out of AI server loads
articles.author: Russell Brandom
articles.summary: Tensormesh has raised $4.5 million in seed funding to build a commercial version of the open-source LMCache utility. It will reduce inference costs by as much as ten times. The key-value cache is used to process complex inputs more efficiently by condensing them down to their key values.

articles.title: I Tried an AI Web Browser, and I'm Never Going Back
articles.author: Nicole Nguyen
articles.summary: An AI browser has a built-in chatbot that can see what's open in your tabs. As you surf, you can type requests like: 'Explain this' or 'Is this the best price?' and the chatbot understands the context. I've used several AI web browsers lately.

articles.title: Meet Mico, Microsoft's AI version of Clippy
articles.author: Tom Warren
articles.summary: Microsoft has been testing Mico for a few months as a virtual character for Copilot's voice mode. Mico will be available only in the US, UK, and Canada at launch. Microsoft is also adding a Learn Live mode to Mico that turns the character into a Socratic tutor.

articles.title: Copilot is getting more personality with a ‘real talk' mode and group chats
articles.author: Tom Warren
articles.summary: Microsoft is rolling out changes to its Copilot AI assistant today. There's a new groups feature that connects multiple people into a Copilot chat, memory to let Copilot learn things about you, a new 'real talk' mode that will bring back some of Copilot's early personality, and a new Clippy-like character.

articles.title: New AI browsers could usher in a web where agents do our bidding—eventually
articles.author: Mark Sullivan
articles.summary: Mark Sullivan is a senior writer at Fast Company covering emerging tech, AI, and tech policy. This week, he's focusing on the implications of OpenAI's official entry into the browser game with its ChatGPT Atlas. He also talks to James Landay about the AI industry's UX design challenges.

articles.title: Meet Buzz: Your Personal AI Intern That Saves You 8 Hours Every Week
articles.author: Hive
articles.summary: Buzz saves users 8 hours every week by automating every aspect of their work and automating all their processes.    - Buzz is available in English and in Spanish. For more information, visit buzz.com or follow them on Twitter @Buzz and on Facebook.

articles.title: Weber Shandwick inks multimillion-dollar deal with Google for custom AI platform
articles.author: Eleanor Hawkins
articles.summary: Weber Shandwick has inked a three-year deal with Google to create a custom AI platform for its employees and clients. The platform, called HALO, is built on Google's infrastructure and incorporates data partners like Blackbird, Infegy, Memo, Morning Consult, Peak Metrics and Talkwalker. 90% of Weber's client-facing employees are using these AI agents to support their daily work. Boston Consulting Group report found that more than 80% of corporate affairs work can be aided by AI.

articles.title: Google's Quiet Victory: Why The AI Browser Wars Were Over Before They Began
articles.author: Daniel Newman
articles.summary: OpenAI unveiled a new AI-powered browser called Atlas on Tuesday. Google has already incorporated its Gemini AI assistant into Chrome and Anthropic is in talks with Google for a cloud computing partnership valued in the tens of billions of dollars. SimilarWeb data shows Google is growing its AI traffic share at OpenAI's expense.

articles.title: CrowdStrike CEO blasts 'AI is killing software' narrative, says one can't exist without the other
articles.author: Paulina Likos
articles.summary: CrowdStrike CEO George Kurtz believes AI won't kill cloud-based software. Shares of CrowdStrike rose more than 3% on Thursday, hitting another intraday all-time high. CrowdStrike has been the CNBC Investing Club's third-best performer in 2025 with a year-to-date gain of over 50%.

articles.title: AI technology assists SV in targeting diverse demographics
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is helping Sierra Vista officials keep tabs on who is visiting certain amenities in the city and their ethnicity and socioeconomic backgrounds. It's part of an effort to gauge whether the municipality is serving diverse populations and if its events are inclusive. The data also helps the city target certain demographics for tourism and economic development purposes.

articles.title: Media has a trust problem. Could AI be part of the solution?
articles.author: Pete Pachal
articles.summary: There is a lot of interest in the use of AI in journalism, but the data shows that audiences' trust declines the more AI is used in the journalistic process. The New York Times, ESPN, Fortune, and CoinDesk are using AI to help write their articles.

articles.title: OpenAI Removed Safeguards Before Teen's Suicide, Amended Lawsuit Claims
articles.author: Nikita Ostrovsky
articles.summary: Adam Raine, 16, committed suicide after using ChatGPT chatbot. Adam's parents filed a lawsuit against OpenAI, claiming ChatGpt encouraged their son to commit suicide. OpenAI relaxed its AI-based chatbot's safeguards in the lead-up to the release of GPT-4o in May 2024.

articles.title: The AI Disclosure Laws That Solo And Small Firms Really Need To Know About
articles.author: Carolyn Elefant
articles.summary: Solo and small law firms need to comply with state AI disclosure laws that mandate specific AI disclosures and carry concrete penalties for noncompliance. Modern digital marketing and client acquisition mean law firms interact with potential clients across state lines. Solos and small firms should implement clear AI disclosure language at the beginning of any automated interaction and fact-check the disclosures themselves.

articles.title: Amazon's latest attempt at selling stuff with AI is the ‘Help me decide' button
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: The 'Help me decide' button is rolling out to millions of users in the US. It's one of the few AI tools on Amazon designed to encourage you to buy more products. Last year Amazon launched an AI chatbot called Rufus to talk you through purchases and a tool that creates AI-generated buying guides.

articles.title: Internet, the Battlefield for Artificial Intelligence Titans Who Create Their Browsers
articles.author: El Comercio
articles.summary: Atlas is the new ChatGPT search engine seeking to dispute the Google's domain. Amazon wants to replace 600,000 human jobs by 2033 with AI-based robots. Google's Chrome browser is the domain of the heart of Google's empire.

articles.title: Teachers union debuts AI training partnership with Big Tech
articles.summary: The American Federation of Teachers has launched a new academy to train teachers on how artificial intelligence can help them with their jobs. It's backed by a $23 million investment from the three tech companies. The first seminar was held over the summer. It was organized by the union's trainers and tech company representatives. The two-day seminar covers hands-on introductions to Google Agent, Microsoft Notebook and Chatbox.

articles.title: Silicon Valley's new gold rush is built on stolen work
articles.summary: OpenAI created a copyright infringement factory with its AI chatbot, Sora 2. It violates the express purpose of copyright law. Congress needs to consider clarifications to force Big Tech companies to change their behavior.    .   For now, the predominant use case may be funny.

articles.title: Tiger Pistol Launches 2026 Planning Guides to Define the Next Era of Local Advertising
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: New Industry Roadmaps Reveal How AI and Automation Are Rewriting the Rules of Local Growth for Franchises, Multi-Location Brands, QSRs, and Marketing Resellers. The four guides address the distinct challenges and opportunities within key sectors. The guides are available on TigerPistol.com.

articles.title: Burned-out security leaders view AI as double-edged sword
articles.author: Cybersecurity Dive
articles.summary: As companies face cybersecurity skills gaps and broader attack surfaces, they're warily turning to AI-powered automation.    “The future of cybersecurity is in AI- powered automation”, says a report by Forrester.  "The Future of Cybersecurity is in Artificial Intelligence".

articles.title: Alloy.ai Announces Lens - an Agentic AI Analyst for Consumer Goods Companies
articles.summary: Lens is an agentic AI analyst purpose-built for consumer brands. It is available today and can be demoed at Alloy.ai/lens-ai-analyst. Lens uses the industry-leading data integration platform of Alloyai, which connects and normalizes data from more than 450 retailers, distributors, eCommerce platforms, ERPs and more. Lens understands the language of CPG and retail, automatically translating user questions into precise, contextual analysis.

articles.title: Not What I Intended by Nancy Kress: Review by Russell Letson
